title: The Clockwork Orchard
abstract: In a city powered by timekeeping machines, a botanist discovers an orchard that grows gears instead of fruit. As the clockwork ecosystem begins to fail, she must choose between restoring the old order and letting something new evolve.

title: Ashes of the North Wind
abstract: After a winter that never ends, a caravan of survivors follows a map drawn in soot and ash. Two unlikely companions uncover a forgotten pact between the mountains and the wind, and the cost of breaking it.

title: The Silent Archivist
abstract: A university archive receives a box of unsigned letters that seem to predict small tragedies across the city. When a librarian traces the paper to a vanished collection, she finds herself solving a case that everyone else prefers to keep buried.

title: Beneath the Marble Sky
abstract: In the final weeks of a fading empire, a stonecutter is commissioned to carve a monument nobody will ever see. Between politics, patronage, and quiet rebellion, he learns how history is shaped by what is built and what is erased.

title: A Small Theory of Rain
abstract: A physicist returns to her coastal hometown to settle her father's estate and finds notebooks full of weather observations and unfinished poems. As storms gather, she pieces together a family story told through forecasts, omissions, and love.

title: The Last Train to Saffron City
abstract: A night train departs on schedule, but the passenger list changes after every stop. With communications down and an unseen threat onboard, a journalist races to identify who is missing and why the destination doesn't appear on any map.

title: Counting Stars in the Laboratory
abstract: Blending memoir with science writing, this book explores the obsession behind measurement and discovery. From late-night experiments to failed prototypes, it tells the story of how curiosity survives deadlines, funding, and doubt.

title: The Garden of Forgotten Names
abstract: A community garden stands on land once used as a hospital cemetery, and the past refuses to stay quiet. When a new caretaker uncovers faded markers, neighbors confront old promises, new grief, and the fragile art of forgiveness.

title: Neon Harbor
abstract: In a port city where shipping containers hold secrets and data is traded like spice, a courier steals the wrong package. Hunted by corporate divers and street hackers alike, they must decode a message that could sink the entire harbor economy.

title: Songs for a Distant Coast
abstract: A touring musician and a lighthouse keeper strike a bargain to share stories until the summer ends. What begins as a quiet exchange becomes a love shaped by tides, departures, and the fear of returning to ordinary life.

title: Paper Moons and Granite Streets
abstract: A graphic designer inherits a box of street photographs taken by an unknown relative decades earlier. Following the images through a rapidly changing city, he discovers how memory can be preserved, edited, and accidentally rewritten.

title: The Philosopher's Shortcut
abstract: A series of sharp, accessible essays about thinking in public and making peace with uncertainty. Using everyday examples, the author shows how philosophical questions hide inside routines, arguments, and the stories we tell ourselves.

title: When the River Remembers
abstract: A river begins returning objects that were lost generations ago, and the town gathers along its banks to watch. As the water reveals secrets, one family must decide what to reclaim and what to let drift away forever.

title: The Brass Compass
abstract: A scavenger finds a compass that points not north, but toward the owner's greatest mistake. Chasing its pull across deserts and ruined libraries, she assembles a crew and learns that treasure is rarely the real destination.

title: An Algorithm for Ghosts
abstract: A startup trains a model on voice recordings of the dead to comfort the grieving, but the outputs start answering questions nobody asked. As the boundary between simulation and haunting dissolves, an engineer investigates what the system is truly learning.
